lines.text: My books cannot be written in a week. It takes, maybe, years! And when its finished an published, if I sell 2,000 copies, its good.
How much can you make out of 2.000 copies?
Oh, about 700 dollars, if the publisher is generous.
Darling, I'm sorry, I love you just the way you are.
Oh, I don't know, I think maybe it is better for you, oh, a waiter, I'll probably always be a waiter.
Don't say that. Smile. Come on, smile for the pretty lady. Ha-ha-ha. Hold me, Peter. Tight. Tighter. Mmmm.
When you are like this,
You're marvelous.

[Slams phone down]
This is my night off!
What is it, darling?
Oh, I must go again tonight. 270 Park Avenue. Another stupid party, I suppose.
Oh well, it means a 10 dollar tip, anyway.
Yes, but my book, I never finish it.
I'll meet you on the corner of 48th and 5th at 11.
How have you been?
Okay. I've been working pretty hard. I just finished writing a book called Sex and What Causes It. It's for Bernard McGovern. I got five grand out of it.
Five grand!
For only two weeks work. How have you been?
Oh, boy.
Speed, take me out somewhere. I want to go out and play.
I'd love to. That will be delightful. I've got to telephone. Oh, telephone.
[Picks up the phone]
Well, you dirty coward! Hitting a man with his pajamas on!
I'm very busy. What can I do for you?
Mr. Van Dorn, I have a proposition.
I'm not interested in any proposition from you, Mr. Stanislavsky.
There is money in it, for you. Lots of it.
Won't you sit down.
You're just a faker, the world knows it.
And what would you call yourself?
Haven't you read my book?
No, thanks. I have my own.
Yours was written by Speed McCann.
So was yours.
But you were only a waiter.
And you were only the Cherokee Indian that went around with the traveling medicine salesman.
Yes sir. But, I ultimately became promoted to salesman.
Well, if you ask me, being a bridge expert is a step down from being a fake Cherokee Indian.
Between you and me, I preferred to be an Indian. You didn't have to have so much sex appeal.
Oh, he's bridge mad. He'll be bridge mad for the rest of his life. And I'm the one who started him. Oh, Speed, I feel like a creator of a Frankenstein.
I like them myself.
Like what?
Those Frankensteins. You know, on a roll with mustard. Ha-ha-ha. Ain't I the clip.
They won the first three rubbers. And it began to look good for the Alexandrovitch Stanislavsky team. But, now they have lost two rubbers straight. Yes, it looks bad folks. It looks bad.
